primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God uses human actors (specifically Abigail) to preserve the lineage and character of David, ensuring the unfolding of His redemptive plan despite human sin and impulse.

tekstueel_bewijs: There is just one main actor and that is God.
He raises people up and causes them to fall.
God has placed them there and holds their very existence in his hands.

object.identificatie: The preservation of David's 'house' and the Messiah's lineage
tekstueel_bewijs: a tale of suspense on which the unfolding of God’s great plan depends.
The Lord will certainly make my lord a sure house.

zender.identificatie: God as the Sovereign Architect of History
tekstueel_bewijs: Everything that happens is according to his will or permission.
Behind, beneath, above, and before every character in the Bible is the Holy One.
the way of the Son of David was prepared... for people like you and me.
Abigail uses her wits, her beauty, and her political instincts to save her husband’s household.
Blessed be the Lord... who sent you this day to meet me.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Sin (Nabal's folly and David's bloodguilt)
tekstueel_bewijs: David, angry and full of a sense of outraged honor, bent on his bloody and vengeful mission.
Nabal was churlish and evil in his doings.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad mood, but a threat to the Messianic line and the 'sure house' of David.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Abigail's ethical response to the crisis.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Abigail
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Peace and preservation of the household
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Abigail's action is the means through which God (the Primary Subject) executes His will.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has restrained you from bloodguilt.
God uses men and women equally.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: David is forced to live like a sort of Robin Hood.
You and I would no doubt say something of the sort.

voorbeelden: he is going to have to put that sword away.
David... bent on his bloody and vengeful mission.
God uses men and women equally.
given, in spite of themselves, a glimpse.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to restrain human sin and enable human action, rather than human obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (David's anger) through ~S2 (Abigail's intervention) to S1 (God's sovereign preservation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God uses a 'clever opportunist' to move the narrative from judgment to grace.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; David's potential sin is seen as a threat to the Messianic promise.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon focuses heavily on a human character (Abigail), it explicitly frames her as an instrument of a sovereign God. It avoids moralism by stating that God is the only 'main actor' and that humans are 'given' their roles and insights 'in spite of themselves.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: No one can do everything, but everyone can do something.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is just one main actor and that is God.
The Lord has restrained you... before it happened.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abigail is used as a model of 'wits' and 'imagination,' but the preacher immediately grounds this in God's providence.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: Abigail is not a hero of her own making, but a 'match light' ignited by God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe at God's sovereignty over human messiness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic in its ultimate frame, even if synergistic in its historical expression.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Colossi' of the OT to the 'match lights' like Abigail is perfectly integrated into the theme of God's all-encompassing actors.
spanning_punten: The tension between Abigail's 'cleverness' and God's 'restraint' of David.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the way of the Son of David was prepared by... people like you and me.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; sin (bloodguilt) threatens the very plan of God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound. It places God as the Sender and Subject of the meta-narrative, while Abigail serves as a functional Helper.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current emphasis on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'strategy' of Abigail is always linked to the 'Spirit's prompting'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Nabal is seen as a 'boor' or 'wretched.'
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Emphasize that Nabal/David's anger represents the 'flesh' which opposes God's Spirit.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To heighten the necessity of Grace.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of how to preach a 'character study' without falling into the trap of moralistic exemplarism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'sexy man' hook; Greimas focuses on the functional role of Abigail as a Helper to God's Subjectivity.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the Hebrew meaning of 'Nabal' (fool); Greimas looks at Nabal as the 'Opponent' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite the title 'Abigail's Strategy,' the deep structure identifies God as the one strategizing through her.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Rutledge Rule' by framing human action within divine agency.
